docs.title: find-exe
docs.text:
CI/CD Docs Package Meta

This provides a library and CLI (find-exe) to find all executables given certain criteria.

>>> import find_exe
>>> find_exe.with_prefix("py")
['/usr/bin/python', ...]

docs.title: License
docs.text: find-exe is distributed under the terms of the MIT license.

docs.text:
Desktop readers can use special keyboard shortcuts:

Keys Action
  • , (comma)
  • p
Navigate to the "previous" page
  • . (period)
  • n
Navigate to the "next" page
  • /
  • s
Display the search modal

docs.title: with_condition(condition: Callable[[os.DirEntry], bool], *, mode: int = os.F_OK | os.X_OK, path: str | None = None) -> list[str]
docs.text:
Parameters:

Name Type Description Default condition Callable[[DirEntry], bool]

The condition used for searching.

required mode int

The file mode used for checking access.

F_OK | X_OK path str | None

The PATH to check. If None, the PATH environment variable is used.

None

Returns:

Type Description list[str]

A list of absolute paths to executables that match the given pattern.

docs.title: with_pattern(pattern: str | re.Pattern[str], *, mode: int = os.F_OK | os.X_OK, path: str | None = None) -> list[str]
docs.text:
Parameters:

Name Type Description Default pattern str | Pattern[str]

The pattern used for searching.

required mode int

The file mode used for checking access.

F_OK | X_OK path str | None

The PATH to check. If None, the PATH environment variable is used.

None

Returns:

Type Description list[str]

A list of absolute paths to executables that match the given pattern.

docs.title: with_prefix(prefix: str, *, mode: int = os.F_OK | os.X_OK, path: str | None = None) -> list[str]
docs.text:
Parameters:

Name Type Description Default prefix str

The prefix used for searching.

required mode int

The file mode used for checking access.

F_OK | X_OK path str | None

The PATH to check. If None, the PATH environment variable is used.

None

Returns:

Type Description list[str]

A list of absolute paths to executables that match the given prefix.
